intro: Gypsocallis melanthera, commonly known as the black-flowered gypsocallis, is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in coastal and sandy habitats. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces striking, tubular flowers that are typically dark purple to black in color. It blooms during the summer months and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its natural range.
